place.name: PENDOCK
place.gazetteerText: PENDOCK, a parish, with a village, in the district of Tewkesbury and county of Worcester; adjacent to Gloucestershire, 5½ miles W N W of Tewkesbury r. station. Post-town, Tewkesbury. Acres, 1, 163. Real property, £2,056. Pop., 329. Houses, 74. The manor belonged to Worcester abbey. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £330.* Patron, the Rev. W. S. Symonds. The church is old, and has a tower. There are a Wesleyan chapel, and charities £6. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
